page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW.
page.content: The area lies at the N.E. corner of the{Vale of Clwyd.}It is predominantly a farming area (Cattle and sheep). To the east,the valley sides rise to a maximum height of 304m.It is here that an area of coniferous forest is encountered.There are other,smaller, areas of deciduous woodland on the valley floor. The population is rather scattered, the main villages being{Rhuallt,}in the S.E.corner and{Cwm}in the N.E. The main routes are the A55(T)on the southern edge,running E/W,the A525 to the west,running N/S and the A5151 in the north,running E/W. The village of Rhuallt,from which this report originates,is situated at a gap in the Clwydian Hills through which the aforementioned A55 road passes up a short, but fairly steep, incline.
